Package prj02

Class HuffmanCoding

java.lang.Object
prj02.HuffmanCoding
public class HuffmanCoding extends Object
The Huffman Encoding Algorithm This is a data compression algorithm designed by David A. Huffman and published in 1952 What it does is it takes a string and by constructing a special binary tree with the frequencies of each character. This tree generates special prefix codes that make the size of each string encoded a lot smaller, thus saving space.
Since:
10/16/2021
Version:
2.0
Author:
Fernando J. Bermudez Medina (Template), A. ElSaid (Review), Yariel Mercado (Implementation)

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)

    • load_data

      public static String load_data​(String inputFile)
      Receives a file named in parameter inputFile (including its path), and returns a single string with the contents.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - name of the file to be processed in the path inputData/
      Returns:
      String with the information to be processed

    • compute_fd

      public static HashTable.Map<String,​Integer> compute_fd​(String inputString)
      Computes the frequency distribution of the input text and stores the result in a map. The keys are strings representing each distinct character in the input text and the values are integers denoting the amount of times that character appears in the input text. The map is implemented with a hash table: HashTableSC.
      Parameters:
      inputString - The input string received from the given text file.
      Returns:
      Map with each unique character as a key and its number of occurrences as the value.

    • huffman_tree

      public static Tree.BTNode<Integer,​String> huffman_tree​(HashTable.Map<String,​Integer> fD)
      Given the frequency distribution map of the input text, creates a Huffman tree. The tree is built from the leaves of the tree to its root by repeatedly combining the nodes with the lowest frequencies into a single root node. The root node's key is the combined values of the subtrees' frequencies, and its value, the combined characters. Similarly, the nodes' are key-value pairs with the characters' frequency as the keys and their corresponding character as the values. A SortedList automatically sorts the nodes.
      Parameters:
      fD - A frequency distribution map from the input text.
      Returns:
      The root node of the completed Huffman tree.

    • huffman_code

      public static HashTable.Map<String,​String> huffman_code​(Tree.BTNode<Integer,​String> huffmanRoot)
      Given the root of the Huffman tree, traverses it to obtain the corresponding Huffman code of each character. The Huffman codes are stored in a map with keys representing each character. Each characters' value are mapped to their corresponding Huffman codes, of type string. Utilizes a helper function to traverse the Huffman tree.
      Parameters:
      huffmanRoot - The root of the constructed Huffman tree.
      Returns:
      A map containing each unique character and their corresponding Huffman code.

    • encode

      public static String encode​(HashTable.Map<String,​String> encodingMap, String inputString)
      Given the encoding map, generates the Huffman encoded string of the given input string. For every character in the input string, retrieves their corresponding code from the encoding map and builds up the encoded result.
      Parameters:
      encodingMap - A map containing key-value pairs of each character and their respective Huffman codes.
      inputString - The input string received from the given text file.
      Returns:
      The Huffman encoded string of the inputString parameter.

    • process_results

      public static void process_results​(HashTable.Map<String,​Integer> fD, HashTable.Map<String,​String> encodedHuffman, String inputData, String output)
      Receives the frequency distribution map, the Huffman Prefix Code HashTable, the input string, and the output string, and prints the results to the screen (per specifications). Output Includes: symbol, frequency and code. Also includes how many bits has the original and encoded string, plus how much space was saved using this encoding algorithm
      Parameters:
      fD - Frequency Distribution of all the characters in input string
      encodedHuffman - Prefix Code Map
      inputData - text string from the input file
      output - processed encoded string

    • orderFrequencies

      public static SortedLinkedList<Tree.BTNode<Integer,​String>> orderFrequencies​(HashTable.Map<String,​Integer> fD)
      Utilizes a SortedList to order the entries in a frequency distribution map by their frequencies, in ascending order. If two entries have the same frequency, compares the character's values instead as a tie-breaker.
      Parameters:
      fD - A given frequency distribution map of the input text.
      Returns:
      A SortedList with each entry sorted in ascending order, by frequency.

    • traversal_helper

      public static HashTable.Map<String,​String> traversal_helper​(Tree.BTNode<Integer,​String> huffmanRoot, HashTable.Map<String,​String> map, String code)
      Helper function which, given the root of a Huffman tree, traverses it and obtains the corresponding Huffman code of each character. Each character is located at the leaves of the Huffman tree. The code for each character is generated by adding a "0" or a "1" at the end of the string depending on whether the left or right subtrees are recursively searched, respectively. Upon reaching a leaf node, the accumulated code thus far is placed into a map.
      Parameters:
      huffmanRoot - The root of the Huffman tree to be traversed.
      map - Places each character, the current leaf node's value, as the keys and their corresponding Huffman codes as the value.
      code - The Huffman code of a character, as a string.
      Returns:
      The final, updated map with each distinct character from the input text and their Huffman codes.

    • decodeHuff

      public static String decodeHuff​(String output, HashTable.Map<String,​String> lookupTable)
      Auxiliary Method that decodes the generated string by the Huffman Coding Algorithm. Used for output purposes.
      Parameters:
      output - - Encoded String
      lookupTable - A map with the codes of each character from the input text as keys and the characters themselves as the values. Used to decode a Huffman encoded string.
      Returns:
      The decoded String. This should be the original input string parsed from the input file.
